dcterms:creator: L. Eisenberg
T. H. Noe
dcterms:description: A network model used to analyze systemic risk in financial systems, focusing on the interconnections between financial institutions and their liabilities.
dcterms:title: Eisenberg-Noe network

dcterms:description: A statistical distribution used to model random variables that are bounded between 0 and 1, often applied in risk management.
dcterms:title: Beta distributions

dcterms:description: A distribution that is used to model variables whose logarithm is normally distributed, often applied in finance to represent asset prices.
dcterms:title: Log-normal marginal distribution

dcterms:description: A statistical method used to model the dependence structure between random variables, particularly in finance.
dcterms:title: Gaussian copula

dcterms:creator: Z. Feinstein
dcterms:description: A study that investigates the dynamics of financial contagion and the strategies for asset liquidation during crises.
dcterms:title: Financial contagion and asset liquidation strategies

dcterms:creator: Z. Feinstein
B. Rudloff
S. Weber
dcterms:description: A comprehensive analysis of various measures of systemic risk, providing insights into their definitions and applications.
dcterms:title: Systemic risk measures

dcterms:description: Risk measures that estimate the potential loss in value of an asset or portfolio over a defined period for a given confidence interval.
dcterms:title: Value-at-Risk and Expected Shortfall

dcterms:creator: H. Elsinger
dcterms:description: A working paper discussing the implications of financial networks, cross holdings, and the concept of limited liability in the context of systemic risk.
dcterms:title: Financial networks, cross holdings, and limited liability
